title: Definition of Probability Distributions
text: Remember that because X is a random variable that follows a probability distribution, it must follow specific rules of probability. Think about what must the probabilities of a probability distribution sum up to.

title: Probability Distribution Rules
text: What do all the probabilities of a probability distribution sum up to?

subHints.title: Visual Representation
subHints.text: Let's say we have 3 balls, 1 red and 2 blue. We know this is a valid probability distribution with $$P(red)=\frac{1}{3}$$ and $$P(blue)=\frac{2}{3}$$. What does $$P\left(red\right)+P\left(blue\right)$$ sum up to? Is this applicable to all probability distributions?
